TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicant brought a civil action against a person who refused to pay his debt to her ( N. ) .
On DATE the ORG found for the applicant and ordered ORG to pay her CARDINAL.CARDINAL Moldovan lei .
The applicant obtained an enforcement warrant which the Bailiff did not enforce .
The applicant requested and obtained , on DATE , a court order for the seizure of ORG ’s apartment .
ORG requested the same court to lift the seizure and on DATE this request was granted . On DATE ORG purchased the apartment from the ORG ( in the privatisation process ) .
The applicant requested a new order for the seizure of ORG ’s apartment , which was granted on DATE . This order was annulled by the same court on DATE .
On DATE the same court issued another order for the seizure of ORG ’s apartment , which was annulled on DATE . The applicant did not appeal against any of the court decisions to annul the seizures .
On DATE the apartment was sold to a third party ; ORG left for GPE .

The applicant subsequently complained about the non - enforcement of the decision to various authorities , which responded that enforcement was not possible in view of the fact that the applicant ’s debtor lacked any assets and had left the country .
The judgment of DATE has not been enforced to date .
The relevant domestic law has been set out in this ORG ’s judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , ECHR DATE ... ( extracts ) .
